sense.def:
Kadar veter ali sapa
blows
, se zrak premika.

seg.quote: The winds had been blowing from the west.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
blows somewhere
ali kadar veter
blows something somewhere
, tisto premakne drugam.

seg.quote: The dust blew all over the decks.
The wind blew his papers away.

sense.def:
To blow
pomeni poslati tok zraka iz ust.

seg.quote: Eric put his lips close to the hole and blew softly.

sense.def:
To blow bubbles
pomeni delati mehurčke s pihanjem zraka iz ust v tekočino.

To blow a whistle or a horn
pomeni povzročiti zvok, tako da pihnemo v piščalko ali rog.

To blow one's nose
pomeni pihniti zrak iz nosu, da ga očistimo.

To give someone a blow
pomeni nekoga udariti.

seg.quote: He knocked Thomas unconscious with one blow of his fist.

sense.def:
A blow
je tudi dogodek, zaradi katerega smo zelo razočarani ali nesrečni.

seg.quote: It must have been a fearful blow to him.

sense.def:
A blow for a cause or principle
je dejanje, zaradi katerega ima neka stvar ali načelo več možnosti za uspeh.
A blow against a cause or principle
zmanjša možnosti te stvari ali načela za uspeh.

seg.quote: He struck a blow for liberty.

sense.def:
To blow
uporabljamo kot glagol za opisovanje nevšečnih posledic eksplozije.

seg.quote: He would have blown his hand off if he'd fired the gun.
It blew a hole in the roof.

sense.def:
To blow a large amount of money
pomeni hitro zapraviti večji znesek za nepotrebne stvari;

To blow out a flame or a candle
pomeni pihniti v plamen ali svečo, da neha goreti.

Kadar nekaj, na primer težava ali spor,
blows over
, se konča.

Kadar človek
blows something up
ali kadar nekaj
blows up
, je tisto uničeno zaradi eksplozije.

Kadar človek
blows up something
, na primer balon ali zračnico, ju napolni z zrakom.
